Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially black in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of three lines of Coptic text written in black ink, very smudged.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393333) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393333)
